Ive been trying many different things over the past 3 years, and I think this is it. I just had my prescription filled so we'll see how it works.

column2: ashleyhi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Given this medication to relive pain from migraines. Works great!! I have relief within 20 minutes of taking. It is a powder you must mix with water and take it like a shot. It tastes horrible, but by far the only pain reliever that actually relieves the pain caused by migraines.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prescribed for migraine. Powder to dissolve in water (tastes like black licorice---yuck!) must consume like a shot. Leaves residual odor on breath that may resemble adult beverage.  Provides absolutely no relief for migraine or cluster headache relief.

column2: Neal, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: fastest migraine headache relief since Imitrex. Prefer not to use a "triptan"

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've taken Cambia 4 times with very good results every time. After first 2 migraine meds were discont'd and being allergic to Imitrex, finding a good migraine medicine is great!

column2: Sarah, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This product works great! I found that Triptans, another form of migraine treatment, created too many side effects for me to handle. My doctor told me about CAMBIA and my life has changed! Before taking the drug I read user reviews on this website. Another comment mentioned the risks when taking a NSAID drug. This concerned me but I found that it is not against CAMBIA specifically, it's a general warning about all NSAID. I also found that NSAIDs are well accepted in the treatment of migraines and recommeded by the American Academy of Neurology! Im so glad I did my research! I will continue to use CAMBIA for my migraines!:)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Cambia on 2 seperate occasions.  It decreased my migraine pain, but did not take it away.  I still prefer Imitrex over any other medicine for the best Migraine relief.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Worked in 20 minutes.  I felt like a different person!

column2: mdretiree, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Although I received immmediate relief from my migraine, it returned within 2 hours with more intensity. I tried the drug 2x separate times with the same results.  I won't be using it again.

column2: Joe Hendel, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Drug is diclofenac. It is is the most dangerous NSAID concerning heart related deaths. Google the American Heart Association Danish article. Stay away from this drug.
